personal.label: Full Stack Web Developer
personal.summary: Self-thought Full Stack Web Developer former Network Engineer

summary: I was a part of multiple network improvements leading to customer satisfaction
Every customer ticket was a priority so I've always met the SLA with a great time to spare
I was setting up an infrastructure for mass events where the availability and reliability was crucial
Set up network and supported live events with thousands of visitors
I created a workflow with the help of Python scripts to release unused public IPv4 addresses as my personal side project

work.company: AT&T Global Network Services Slovakia, s.r.o.
summary: I proactively reviewed even closed incident tickets to seek problem mitigation
I helped to avoid incidents by seeking out recurring problems and suggesting solutions
I created a documentation system to keep a better overview during Aruba transformation and proactively followed up on found issues
I personally organized and overviewed a transformation at Billa sites
I implemented and documented IEEE 802.1X at our company to pass a security audit
I was flexible to support a wide variety of different devices and services (Huawei, Digi, Sophos, Pulse secure ,LAN, WAN, Wifi solutions, VPN solutions)
The biggest project was migration of Sears stores under AT&T where me and my small team came up with a workflow to migrate 3000 stores in a few months
I worked through a huge amount of language barrier working at the sites with no english speakers with the use of a non-technical translator with successful results
I've met with a variety of devices like Juniper, F5, Aruba, Netgate and more
I lead the calls during the installations with team members from multiple companies and multiple countries
We supported the AT&Ts infrastructure for dedicated customers around the world 24/7.
